thread.title: Mum who 'left her baby in car while she went shopping for 10 minutes' investigated by social services
thread.title_full: Mum who 'left her baby in car while she went shopping for 10 minutes' investigated by social services

author: Shanti Das
title: Mum who 'left her baby in car while she went shopping for 10 minutes' investigated by social services
text:
News Mum who 'left her baby in car while she went shopping for 10 minutes' investigated by social services Police said the child is believed to have been left unattended for at least 10 minutes in Hampden Way car park in Gloucester Share The mother was parked in Hampden Way car park in Gloucester when she allegedly left her baby (Photo: Google) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Social services are investigating after a mother allegedly left her three-month-old baby in the car - while she went SHOPPING. 
Police said the child is believed to have been left unattended for at least 10 minutes. 
They were alerted to the incident by a passerby who claimed she saw the mother walking quickly towards the red Fiat Punto. 
Writing on social media, the witness said: "I thought maybe you'd left your phone or purse in there - oh no, only a baby about five or six months old. 
"Trust me, had I known she was in there alone I would have rang 999 and put your boot through to get the baby out." 
"However I did ring the police and gave them your car reg number and a description of you and the baby. Read More The baby was allegedly left in a red Fiat Punto. This is a file picture (Photo: Rex Features) 
"They will be visiting you to do a welfare check on the baby. 
The alleged incident occurred at Hampden Way car park in Gloucester on Thursday. 
The post about it, shared on Facebook, sparked a fierce backlash with site users. 
Anna Lewis said: "Well done to who ever reported this! Who on earth leaves a baby in a car?!?" 
Bryony Phillips wrote: "I'm far from a perfect parent but would I f**k leave my three--year-old in a car on her own, let alone my 7 month old. 
"Well done for informing the police. I don't care what the circumstances are neither of my children would be left alone in a car." 
But Donna Church said "Perhaps the baby was asleep and after being awake all night the mother didn't want to risk waking her. 
"Maybe she only wanted one item but was caught by a long queue and slow cashier, hence why she was rushing back." 
"No wonder parents don't seek help these days with all the 'perfect' parents out there waiting to jump on you," she added. 
Gloucestershire Constabulary said: "We received a report from a member of the public at 10.40am yesterday who was concerned about a baby being left in a car. 
"The baby, who is three to four months old, is believed to have been left in the car unattended for at least 10 minutes. 
"The officer spoke with the baby's mother, who denied the caller's claims. 
"The officer also saw the baby, who appeared to be safe and well. We have advised social care of the incident." 
The spokesman added: "It goes without saying that babies and small children should not be left in vehicles on their own." Like us on Facebook
